channel.title: Pc Build
channel.description:
I know I've made a fair few pc builds before but that's because I'm nervous to commit and seem to be waiting to see new products release to make the price of older items cheaper.
Prev: http://pcpartpicker.com/p/4GVvMp
Current: http://pcpartpicker.com/p/VGx3xr
I've put this together. For a $1000 dollar build do you think this is good for mainly an office/work computer but can also run games such as minecraft/runescape/wow on max graphics with no restrictions?
What can I change to make it better and cheaper.
Basically looks for a super fast/reliable computer. It won't be overclocked because I don't want to make it crazy spec just a good gaming/office computer that is future proof for a good 3-4 years.
My max budget will be $1,100.

item.title: Pc Build
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:553741”]Worth noting that a lot of your discounts are mail in rebates. A lot of people look at MIR and think they are getting a great deal and then never put in the effort to actually submit it.

My other notes on the build:

Overdoing it on the power supply
Overpriced SSD (can get 240 for 85 pretty easily)
If you’re going for the budget mobo/cpu instead of intel, you can also get one of the radeon graphics cards as well[/quote]
What’s a really quality good priced Radeon graphics card that would fit in the budget?

Edit: Updated PSU and SSD check it out here. http://pcpartpicker.com/p/VGx3xr

Read full topic

item.title: Pc Build
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Worth noting that a lot of your discounts are mail in rebates. A lot of people look at MIR and think they are getting a great deal and then never put in the effort to actually submit it.

My other notes on the build:

Overdoing it on the power supply
Overpriced SSD (can get 240 for 85 pretty easily)
If you’re going for the budget mobo/cpu instead of intel, you can also get one of the radeon graphics cards as well

Read full topic

item.title: Pc Build
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

t4:

in general it looks sane. don’t know much about those particular brand releases, but if they have a high rating go for it.

So is it the best it could be for around 1100?
